IO406-d-10-30-06-PATH.Narrative:
ON OCTOBER 30, 2006 AT 3:08AM, ONE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN WAS ASSIGNED TO CUT-UP SEVERAL TRAINS WITHIN A21 CAR CONSIST (881-835-855-624-711-129-665-868-144-733-848-175-152-636-753-884-638-131-812-756-852) AND SEND DEFECTIVE CARS TO HARRISON YARD FOR REPAIR, LEAVING ONLY GOOD EQUIPMENT IN THE YARD FOR THE AM RUSH HOUR.  UNDER THE DIRECTION OF THE NEWARK TRAIN DISPATCHER, THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN MADE THE FOLLOWING MOVES.

AND ADDED THE 7 CARS ON W TRACK,  BELOW THE KEY CROSSOVER.  THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN THEN MOVED 14 CARS TO THE POWER CROSSOVER, CHANGED ENDS AND CROSSED OVER TO E TRACK TO PICK UP THE 2 CARS AND ADD THEM TO THE 14.

WHEN THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN HAD THE 16 CARS ABOVE THE KEY CROSSOVER, SHE CALLED THE DISPATCHER AND TOLD HIM THAT THE 16 CARS WERE SITTING ON TOP OF THE SIGNAL.  THE DISPATCHER INSTRUCTED HER TO GET THE REAMINING 5 CARS BELOW THE KEY CROSSOVER AND ADD THEMTO THE 16 CARS ABOVE THE KEY CROSSOVER.  WHEN THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN APPROACHED THE SIGNAL BELOW THE KEY CROSSOVER, SHE COULD NOT GET A SIGNAL FOR W TRACK.  THE EASTWARD MOVE HAD NOT CLEARED THE INTERLOCKING. BEEM003-d-10-02-06-WVC.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 5:30PM ON OCTOBER 2, 2006, THE 37TH LOADED COAL CAR OF A 45 CAR LOADED COAL TRAIN DERAILED ON THE WEST VIRGINIA CENTRAL RAILROAD'S BEECH MOUNTAIN (BEEM) DIVISION MAIN TRACK AT HANGINGROCK, WEST VIRGINIA, NEAR ALEXANDRIA, WV.  LOCAL TEMPERATURE WAS APPROXIMATELY 75 DEGREES.  METHODOF OPERATION FOR THE BEECH MOUNTAIN INTERCHANGE TRACK IN UNCONTROLLED YARD LIMITS.  LOCATION OF THEINCIDENT WAS APPROXIMATELY BEEM MILEPOST 2.8.  THE LEADING AXLE OF THE 37TH CAR'S TRAILING TRUCK DERAILED INITIALLY IN THE CENTER OF THE 31 DEGREE CURVE.  THE DERAILED AXLE CONTINUED FOR APPROXIMATELY200 FEET, WHEN THE TRAILING AXLE OF THE TRUCK ALSO DERAILED.  THE DERAILED TRUCK CONTINUED APPROXIMATELY 2 MILES, UNTIL A SWITCH FROG WAS ENCOUNTERED AT NEAR MP 2.6.  THE 37TH CAR ROLLED OVER INTO THE ADJOINING DITCH, ALSO ROLLING OVER THE PRECEDING 36TH COAL CAR.  THE 38TH TRAILING CAR WAS DAMAGEDIN THE DERAILMENT AS WELL.  THE TRAIN WAS PLACED INTO EMERGENCY AT THIS POINT.  PRIMARY CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS FAILURE OF THE 37TH CAR'S TRAILING TRUCK TO PROPERLY TURN THROUGH THE SHARP 31 DEGREE HANGING ROCK CURVE.  NO CASUALTIES OCCURRED AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT.
